snippet: Declaring Syria’s opposition as its legitimate representative, marks a new phase of engagement for President Obama in a nearly two-year bloody struggle.
abstract: Pres Obama says United States will formally recognize coalition of Syrian opposition groups as that country's legitimate representative, in attempt to intensify pressure on Pres Bashar al-Assad to give up his bloody struggle to stay in power; announcement, which was widely expected, marks a new phase of American engagement in Syria's bitter internal conflict.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER, MICHAEL R. GORDON and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Mark Landler and Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut.
